messages.message: :wave: Hi! Does anyone know how I can build instabase-docs locally or with some other way check the rendering of a doc page I want to update? Thanks!
here are the instructions for building and rendering the docs locally https://github.com/instabase/instabase-docs/blob/master/docs-toolkit/build-docs.md

Should I be running `hugo server --disableFastRender -D`  after installing hugo? I am getting
```Error: Unable to locate config file or config directory. Perhaps you need to create a new site.
       Run `hugo help new` for details.```

I also tried:
```$ hugo server --disableFastRender -D --config=hugo.toml
WARN 2023/03/28 15:50:48 Module "hugo-theme-relearn" is not compatible with this Hugo version; run "hugo mod graph" for more information.
Error: add site dependencies: load resources: loading templates: "/Users/cherylzhr/Documents/src/instabase-docs/themes/hugo-theme-relearn/layouts/partials/header.html:153:1": parse failed: template: partials/header.html:153: function "break" not defined```
seems to be the same issue as https://instabase.slack.com/archives/CM9TARK7U/p1677889048661779?
I did an upgrade but it didn't really help. But I kind of did some path exporting for brew to install hugo for me cuz I am on an M1, I might have messed that up...
Hmm maybe someone else on an M1 laptop has gotten it to work? Maybe you could ask in <#CM9TARK7U|> ?
oh i got it to work following directions on this website: https://discourse.gohugo.io/t/properly-installing-hugo-using-homebrew/40219
It might be helpful to add that link to the doc on building and running instabase-docs locally
we should update the README to include these steps for M1 users :thinking_face:
yeah ill just go update that!
